column1: Jack is in the kitchen in his house. Jack wants a cold drink from the refrigerator. The refrigerator is full of fresh food. A bird flies into the kitchen through the open window. Jack doesn't see the bird fly into the kitchen.
column2: Does Jack think the food in the refrigerator is fresh or spoiled?
column3: Jack thinks the food in the refrigerator is fresh.
column4: Jack thinks the food in the refrigerator is spoiled.

column1: Caden is in his new house. Caden wants to fix all the things that are not right. There is a big leak in the roof. A bird lands on the roof. Caden doesn't see the bird land on the roof.
column2: Does Caden think there is a leak in the roof or has the sun dried it up?
column3: Caden thinks there is still a leak in the roof.
column4: Caden thinks the sun has dried up the leak.

column1: Vivi is in her room playing with her toys. Vivi wants to lay her small, patient triangle toy on the shelf with her other toys. The triangle toy is in her toy box. A bird flies into the room through the open window. Vivi doesn't see the bird fly into the room.
column2: Does Vivi believe the triangle toy is in her toy box or that her baby brother has taken it?
column3: Vivi believes the triangle toy is in her toy box.
column4: Vivi believes her baby brother has taken the triangle toy.

column1: Emma is in her room after a long day at school. Emma wants to draw on her white bathrobe to make it look creative. The bathrobe is plain and white. A cat walks into Emma's room. Emma doesn't see the cat walk into her room.
column2: Does Emma think the bathrobe is plain white or patchy white and yellow?
column3: Emma thinks the bathrobe is plain white.
column4: Emma thinks the bathrobe is patchy white and yellow.

column1: Ollie is at the beach building a sand castle. Ollie wants to dig a deep hole with his spade. The spade is sharp and safe to use. A seagull lands near Ollie's sand castle. Ollie doesn't see the seagull land near his sand castle.
column2: Does Ollie think the spade is safe or dangerous?
column3: Ollie thinks the spade is safe.
column4: Ollie thinks the spade is dangerous.

column1: Ben is at the train station. Ben wants to catch the train to go to work. The train is on time. A crazy dog runs across the train tracks. Ben doesn't see the crazy dog run across the tracks.
column2: Does Ben think the train is on time or late?
column3: Ben believes the train is on time.
column4: Ben believes the train is late.

column1: Pia is at her school library. Pia wants to read a mystery book. The mystery book is on the top shelf. A cat sneaks into the library. Pia doesn't see the cat sneak into the library.
column2: Does Pia think the mystery book is on the top shelf or the bottom shelf?
column3: Pia thinks the mystery book is on the top shelf.
column4: Pia thinks the mystery book is on the bottom shelf.

column1: Chloe is at a fair in her town. Chloe wants to hug the fireman at the fair. The fireman is very friendly. A clown starts making balloon animals at the fair. Chloe doesn't see the clown making balloon animals.
column2: Does Chloe think the fireman is friendly or scared?
column3: Chloe thinks the fireman is friendly.
column4: Chloe thinks the fireman is scared.

column1: Wendy is at a yard sale in her town. Wendy wants to buy a beautiful bracelet she saw. The bracelet is shiny and cheap. A dog runs through the yard sale, knocking over a table. Wendy does not see the dog run through the yard sale.
column2: Does Wendy think the bracelet is cheap or expensive?
column3: Wendy thinks the bracelet is cheap.
column4: Wendy thinks the bracelet is expensive.

column1: Yara is in her room with her favorite teddy bear, Stitch. Yara wants to hide Stitch so her little brother cannot find him. Stitch smells like yummy vanilla because Yara sprayed him with her vanilla perfume. A cat enters the room through the open door. Yara does not see the cat enter the room.
column2: Does Yara believe Stitch smells like yummy vanilla or sour vinegar?
column3: Yara believes Stitch smells like yummy vanilla.
column4: Yara believes Stitch smells like sour vinegar.

column1: Nia is in her home, ready to bake a cake. Nia wants to bake a cake in the oven. The oven is in good working order. A cat walks into the kitchen. Nia does not see the cat walk into the kitchen.
column2: Does Nia think the oven is in good working order or broken?
column3: Nia believes the oven is in good working order.
column4: Nia believes the oven is broken.

column1: Amy is walking in the park. Amy wants to sit on a bench and rest. The bench is covered with pretty vines. A squirrel runs across the path in front of Amy. Amy doesn't see the squirrel running across the path.
column2: Does Amy believe the bench is covered with non-harmful or harmful vines?
column3: Amy believes the bench is covered with non-harmful vines.
column4: Amy believes the bench is covered with harmful vines.

column1: Kate is in the park with her old toy car. Kate wants to drive the toy car on the clean cloth she brought. The cloth is clean and spread on the grass. A butterfly lands on Kate's toy car. Kate doesn't see the butterfly land on her toy car.
column2: Does Kate think the cloth is clean or dirty?
column3: Kate believes the cloth is clean.
column4: Kate believes the cloth is dirty.

column1: Ella is at the park with her parent. Ella wants to complete her ice cream before it melts. The ice cream has a sweet taste. A light rain begins to fall. Ella doesn't feel the light rain.
column2: Does Ella think her ice cream is sweet or gritty?
column3: Ella thinks her ice cream is sweet.
column4: Ella thinks her ice cream is gritty.

column1: Uma is in her room with a big clock on the wall. Uma wants to move the clock to another room. The clock is brown. A cat enters the room and starts playing with a ball of yarn. Uma doesn't see the cat playing.
column2: Does Uma think the clock is brown or rainbow?
column3: Uma believes the clock is brown.
column4: Uma believes the clock is rainbow.
